lead: Robotics is rapidly evolving, with significant developments in funding, technology, and industry focus, particularly in Europe and Asia.

stories.title: The Robotics Explosion in China
stories.summary: China is leading a robotics revolution, showcasing advancements that surpass those in the United States. The article discusses how this robotics explosion is part of a larger trend of technological and cultural dominance by China. Various sectors are experiencing rapid automation, significantly impacting global industries.

stories.title: ASUS Shifts Focus Towards Robotics and AI
stories.summary: ASUS has announced it will not release new smartphones this year, hinting at a strategic shift towards AI and robotics projects. Chairman Jonney Shih indicated that the company might explore opportunities in robotics and smartglasses, marking a significant pivot in their business strategy. This move reflects a broader trend of tech companies reallocating resources towards emerging technologies.

stories.title: Europe’s €307 Million AI Funding Call
stories.summary: The European Commission has launched a €307 million funding initiative aimed at advancing AI, robotics, and related technologies. This funding is part of a strategic effort to foster trustworthy AI and enhance European digital autonomy. While the amount may seem modest compared to global investments, it signals a commitment to developing critical technologies within Europe.
